description: Number of invariants in Hilbert basis for binary forms of degree n.
comments: Extending this is related to a "gorgeous open question of great antiquity" [Towber].
references: Roe Goodman and Nolan R. Wallach, Representations and invariants of the classical groups, Cambridge Univ. Press, Cambridge, 1998
P. J. Olver, Classical Invariant Theory, Cambridge Univ. Press, p. 40.
links: A. E. Brouwer and M. Popoviciu, The invariants of the binary nonic, J. Symb. Comput. 45 (2010) 709-720.
A. E. Brouwer and M. Popoviciu, The invariants of the binary decimic, J. Symb. Comput. 45 (2010) 837-843.
J. Towber, Review of "Representations and Invariants of the Classical Groups" by Roe Goodman and Nolan R. Wallach, Bull. Amer. Math. Soc., 36 (1999), 533-538.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
